Steps to Reproduce: Launch content_manager.py on a machine where C:\Users\corte\VS Code Projects\Tienda Ebano\data does not exist
Expected: App derives data_dir from the repo root or user config and starts normally
Actual: Initialization raises ProductRepositoryError because the default data_dir points to the maintainer's absolute Windows path
Root Cause: DEFAULT_CONFIG hard-codes a user-specific absolute path
Fix: ✅ Resolved: DEFAULT_CONFIG now derives data_dir/log_dir from the project root

Expected: Lint should execute and enforce repo style rules
Actual: Command aborts with 'ESLint couldn't find an eslint.config' (v9 migration)
Root Cause: ESLint 9 defaults require eslint.config.js but repo still ships .eslintrc.json with no pinned version
Fix: ✅ Resolved: pinned eslint@8.x in devDependencies to align with .eslintrc.json

Steps to Reproduce: Inspect cart helpers after building or run npm test to observe dual definitions
Expected: Single cart module exported and reused across runtime and tests
Actual: File contains duplicated addToCart/saveCart/updateCartIcon implementations (lines 1036-1126 vs 1810-1918) with diverging analytics logic
Root Cause: Refactors added local closures without extracting shared module, leaving two code paths to maintain
Fix: ✅ Resolved: consolidated to single cart implementation in script.mjs

Steps to Reproduce: Open /pages/<category>.html while offline or throttle network to 'Slow 3G'
Expected: Pre-rendered markup or inline payload keeps category usable without network
Actual: Product grid stays empty; initApp falls back to error banner because no inline data exists
Root Cause: build-pages renders shell only and relies on live fetch for all products
Fix: ✅ Resolved: build-pages now inlines category products and markup for offline/JS-disabled use

Steps to Reproduce: Run npm run lighthouse:audit or load the site locally without Cloudflare in front
Expected: Images load without console errors in all environments
Actual: Lighthouse flags multiple 404s for /cdn-cgi/image/... URLs and Best Practices score drops to 0
Root Cause: cfimg() always rewrites to Cloudflare CDN endpoints even when running locally/GitHub Pages without that service
Fix: ✅ Resolved: cfimg defaults to raw assets; gating via CFIMG_ENABLE/CFIMG_DISABLE with tests

Actual: LargestContentfulPaint ~3.0 s and INP proxy (maxPotentialFID) at 91 ms
Root Cause: Hero image and multiple font preloads delay above-the-fold paint despite inline data
Fix: Oversized hero asset and aggressive preloads compete for bandwidth on mobile
Owner: Reduce hero image size/priority and defer non-critical font hints; consider skeleton to shift LCP to lightweight element

Actual: Environment reports v25.0.0, diverging from CI runtime and Volta pin
Root Cause: Local Volta/nvm guardrails not enforced; contributors may install unsupported majors
Fix: Document Volta usage in setup script and add CI preflight to fail when node -v >=25

Expected: UI layer split into view components/controllers for testability
Actual: Single Tkinter file mixes state, network sync, image IO, and threading logic (>2k LOC)
Root Cause: Incremental features accumulated without layering or presenter abstraction
Fix: Break GUI into packages (views, services, image loaders) and add unit coverage around controllers

Steps to Reproduce: Inspect CI workflow or observe PR builds
Expected: Python domain tests run alongside JS suites
Actual: CI only runs npm build/test/lighthouse; admin/product_manager pytest suite never executes
Fix: Add Python setup (pip install) and run pytest admin/product_manager/tests

Steps to Reproduce: Build the site, go offline, then open /index.html; inspect SW cache contents
Expected: All JS entrypoints and chunks are precached so offline navigation works
Actual: Chunks under /dist/js/chunks/ are missing from the static cache, causing offline JS failures when splitting
Root Cause: Static asset list is hardcoded and ignores esbuild chunk outputs
Fix: ✅ Resolved: manifest-driven precache covers all build outputs; verify-sw-assets enforces presence

Steps to Reproduce: Inspect cart helpers or run npm test to see duplicate implementations
Expected: Cart logic lives in a single module reused across runtime and tests
Actual: Two divergent cart implementations exist (lines ~950–1127 vs ~1797–1903), risking drift
Root Cause: Refactors duplicated add/remove/update helpers instead of extracting a shared module
Fix: ✅ Resolved: removed duplicate cart block; single implementation remains

Steps to Reproduce: Open /pages/<category>.html offline or with JS disabled
Expected: Category pages render products or show offline-ready fallback
Actual: Grid stays empty because pages rely solely on runtime fetches
Root Cause: Build-time render omits inline product payload for category pages
Fix: ✅ Resolved: category pages pre-render products with inline JSON and offline fallback

Steps to Reproduce: Serve site locally or on GitHub Pages and check network panel
Expected: Images load without /cdn-cgi/image errors when Cloudflare is absent
Actual: Image requests 404 via /cdn-cgi/image/... rewriting even when CF proxy is unavailable
Root Cause: cfimg() unconditionally rewrites URLs to Cloudflare CDN
Fix: ✅ Resolved: CF rewrite opt-in; defaults to raw asset paths build/runtime

Steps to Reproduce: Profile initial load; structured data injects after inline payload is present
Expected: No extra fetch when product data is already embedded
Actual: injectStructuredData triggers a second fetch with cache 'no-store' despite inline data
Fix: ✅ Resolved: reads inline payload first; falls back with cache-friendly fetch

Steps to Reproduce: Inspect font preload URLs after rebuilding assets
Expected: Font preloads stay in sync with hashed outputs
Actual: Preload hrefs are hardcoded to old hash names; rebuilds can 404 and hurt LCP
Root Cause: Preloads are not sourced from build outputs
Fix: ✅ Resolved: font preloads sourced from asset manifest with fallback

Expected: External assets use SRI or are self-hosted
Actual: Bootstrap Icons CSS is fetched from CDN without integrity/crossorigin
Root Cause: Missing SRI/self-hosting for third-party icon font
Fix: ✅ Resolved: added SRI/crossorigin to Bootstrap Icons include

Steps to Reproduce: Submit cart without selecting payment method
Expected: Error feedback announced in-page with focusable region
Actual: An alert() is shown ('Por favor seleccione un método de pago'), which is not accessible
Fix: ✅ Resolved: inline error region with focus on payment radios

Steps to Reproduce: Inspect test tooling and CI gates
Expected: Coverage instrumentation exists and is enforced
Actual: No coverage collection (c8) or coverage gate is configured
Root Cause: Coverage requirement noted in docs but not implemented
Fix: Add c8-based coverage script and wire into CI to track thresholds
